content:
• Wednesday, August 1, 2012
  • ANDV

    More on Tesoro (TSO): Q2 easily beats across the board. Net earnings jumped 78% Y/Y on better...

    More on Tesoro (TSO): Q2 easily beats across the board. Net earnings jumped 78% Y/Y on better gross refining margins and lower overall expenses. Gross margin widened to 15.1% from 12.3%, as input costs and operating costs decreased. Shares +4.6% AH.

  • KODK

    A bankruptcy judge gives Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK +21.2%) a partial victory in its battle against...

    A bankruptcy judge gives Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK +21.2%) a partial victory in its battle against Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), affirming the company's ownership of 2 patents Apple claimed as its own. Summary judgment was denied for another 8 patents Kodak and Apple are fighting over. The patents are part of a collection of 1,100 Kodak is planning to sell - Apple is part of one of the consortiums reported to be bidding on them. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM | 7 Comments
  • TRMB

    More on Trimble Navigation (NASDAQ:TRMB): Q2 beats on all counts with a 27% jump in total...

    More on Trimble Navigation (NASDAQ:TRMB): Q2 beats on all counts with a 27% jump in total revenue. Net earnings were flat however, as expenses rose on a 33% increase in operating costs. The company issued upbeat guidance for Q3, now seeing its EPS between $0.62 and $0.64 per share on revenue of $492M and $497M. Street estimates are for an EPS of $0.62 on revenue of $485M. Shares +8.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:32 PM
  • BAX

    Baxter (NYSE:BAX) confirms it's received a complete response letter from the FDA delaying the...

    Baxter (NYSE:BAX) confirms it's received a complete response letter from the FDA delaying the approval of its investigational product HyQ. More specifically, the agency says it's seeking additional preclinical data focusing on issues related to non-neutralizing antibodies and the possible effects they have on reproduction, development and fertility. HyQ, which is in development with Halozyme Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HALO), is a treatment that aims to allow physicians to tailor antibody drug therapy to the needs of patients with immune-system disorders. BAX -0.6%, HALO -54% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM

    More on Mako Surgical Corp (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q2 EPS loss beats by a penny on revenue in line with...

    More on Mako Surgical Corp (NASDAQ:MAKO): Q2 EPS loss beats by a penny on revenue in line with estimates. Total revenue jumped over 27% on higher systems sales and procedures. Over 2,590 MAKOplasty procedures were performed in the second quarter, a 66% increase over the same period in 2011. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) -15.8% AH after warning FQ2 (ended July 28) sales totaled...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) -15.8% AH after warning FQ2 (ended July 28) sales totaled $951.4M (+4% Y/Y), well below a $1.01B consensus. EPS is expected to come in at $0.15-$0.18, below a $0.33 consensus. Same-store sells fell 10% - 5% in the U.S., and a whopping 26% internationally. June was the weakest month. Gross margin is expected to be down 100 bps Y/Y, and inventory up 20%. Abercrombie now expects FY12 EPS of $2.50-$2.75, below a $3.39 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) +5.7% AH after raising its Q2 EPS guidance to $0.19-$0.21 from a prior $0.13-$0.15 outlook and $0.15 analyst consensus, primarily due to stronger than expected sales. Q2 net sales rose 11% Y/Y to $740M vs. $714M consensus; comparable store sales increased 9%.

    United Online (NASDAQ:UNTD) +7.1% AH after announcing it will spin off its FTD online flower...

    United Online (NASDAQ:UNTD) +7.1% AH after announcing it will spin off its FTD online flower delivery unit into a separate, publicly-traded company. United has also posted its Q2 results: EPS of $0.18 beat by $0.05, and revenue of $231.9M (-9% Y/Y) was roughly in-line. Q3 revenue guidance is also in-line. FTD accounted for 72% of United's Q2 sales - the division's revenue fell 5% Y/Y.

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): Q2 EPS of $1.65 beats by $0.75. Revenue of $957.3M (+80% Y/Y) beats by $137.4M. Expects 2012 revenue of $3.6B-$3.9B, above $3.48B consensus. Expects 2012 EPS of $4-$4.50, above $3.95 consensus. Company also announces it's developing a 139MW California solar project, and that CEO James Hughes has been added to the board. Shares +13.5% AH. (PR)

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ3 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $869M...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR): FQ3 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $869M (+21% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Lowers FY13 EPS estimate to $2.55-$2.60. Earnings CC scheduled for 5:00 PM EST. (webcast) Shares halted AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • OC

    Shares of Owens Corning (OC +2.4%) had a volatile day after missing Q2 estimates earlier this...

    Shares of Owens Corning (OC +2.4%) had a volatile day after missing Q2 estimates earlier this morning. Net profit plunged 50% as revenue fell due to sales declines in its building materials and composites segments. CEO Mike Thaman notes that economic conditions still very uncertain, and the housing market remains weak, but he sees signs of housing recovery in the second half.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • AEGN

    Aegion (AEGN +5.3%), which posted an encouraging Q2 on Monday on improving operating conditions...

    Aegion (AEGN +5.3%), which posted an encouraging Q2 on Monday on improving operating conditions and margins, gets another boost today from an upgrade to Buy at Ladenburg Thalmann. In its note to clients, the firm says the results suggest the plan to return to profitability that management laid out at the end of 2011 is working.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • FB

    Fidelity slashes its Facebook (FB -3.6%) stake - 21 of its funds selling over 1.9M shares in...

    Fidelity slashes its Facebook (FB -3.6%) stake - 21 of its funds selling over 1.9M shares in June. The sales are quick ones for Fidelity, which likes to "kick the tires and ask questions," says John Bonnanzio of Fidelity Insight. "It seems they ultimately decided that they didn't like what they see."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 7 Comments
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM +6.7%) posted a 72% lower Q2 profit from a year ago on weak commodity...

    Talisman Energy (TLM +6.7%) posted a 72% lower Q2 profit from a year ago on weak commodity prices but results aren't as bad as some had feared, and shares surge. Total production rose 4% Y/Y to 435K boe/day on higher volumes in Southeast Asia and from North American shale, but falling prices more than offset that growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • ENR

    Energizer (ENR -11%) is getting punished today after posting FQ3 results that missed top line...

    Energizer (ENR -11%) is getting punished today after posting FQ3 results that missed top line estimates. Total revenue dropped nearly 9% Y/Y, due to weakness in battery sales and higher competition on razors. The company also issued a cautious outlook, noting that competition in its personal-care business has ratcheted up recently, as well as signs of softening economic conditions. The company warned that further action might need to be taken to adjust its cost structure.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.3%) bounce up and down on brisk volume in...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +0.3%) bounce up and down on brisk volume in advance of the company's FQ3 earnings report slated to be released after the close. Though investors assuredly have their hard hats on after GMCR's FQ2 report led to a 40% freefall in share price, the company has already lowered the bar quite a bit this time around with its own guidance. One disturbing note heading into the report: Perma-GMCR bull Janney quietly lowered its estimate for the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS -13%) gets slammed today after reporting a Q2 top line that fell far short of...

    Amyris (AMRS -13%) gets slammed today after reporting a Q2 top line that fell far short of Street estimates yesterday. The company attributes the decline to the planned wind-down of Amyris Fuels, it's ethanol and gasoline trading business, and increased costs associated with the production of it's renewable products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • FRX

    Carl Icahn’s latest attempt to change the board of Forest Labs (FRX -1.6%) gets a partial...

    Carl Icahn’s latest attempt to change the board of Forest Labs (FRX -1.6%) gets a partial backing from proxy advisory firm ISS, which says it supports two of Icahn’s four nominees for the board and voices lingering doubts about corporate governance. FRX stands by its board slate and says ISS "undervalues future sales potential" at the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • GNW

    Genworth (GNW -7.7%) CEO Martin Klein, under pressure to shed its money-losing mortgage...

    Genworth (GNW -7.7%) CEO Martin Klein, under pressure to shed its money-losing mortgage insurance unit, says the cost of winning boldholder approval "could be significant" and spinning off the unit "may not be viable" now. “They can’t really give the market what it wants, which is a very clear game plan in terms of what the go-forward strategy is," a UBS analyst says. (Q2 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • CBRE

    CBRE Group (CBG +7%) pops after beating top line Q2 estimates late yesterday. Net income surged...

    CBRE Group (CBG +7%) pops after beating top line Q2 estimates late yesterday. Net income surged 24% Y/Y, as global profit rose in every one of its business lines. Performance was particularly strong in its Americas region - its largest top-line contributor - which posted strong revenue growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • NCR

    NCR Corp. (NCR +5.5%) plans to boost the underfunded status of its pension by $800M through...

    NCR Corp. (NCR +5.5%) plans to boost the underfunded status of its pension by $800M through contributions and by offering a voluntary lump-sum payment option to some former workers. The ATM maker expects the move to permanently reduce its pension liability, clearing up the overhang of the underfunded status and supporting future profit growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • MAPP

    Shares of MAP Pharmaceuticals (MAPP -5.3%) slide today after the company priced its secondary...

    Shares of MAP Pharmaceuticals (MAPP -5.3%) slide today after the company priced its secondary offering of 3.88M shares at $13.40, a 5% discount to yesterday's close. The company intends to use the proceeds to bring its investigational migraine drug Levadex to market, as well as for other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • CVG

    Convergys (CVG +3%) trades higher today after beating Q2 estimates on both its top and bottom...

    Convergys (CVG +3%) trades higher today after beating Q2 estimates on both its top and bottom line and upping its FY12 EPS guidance yesterday. BGB Securities likes the result, saying the company's fundamentals are strong and the stock should be bought into any strength. It reiterates its Buy rating and $20 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding Group (OSG -8.6%) takes a hit on a Q2 EPS miss today, touching a new...

    Overseas Shipholding Group (OSG -8.6%) takes a hit on a Q2 EPS miss today, touching a new 52-week low of $5 early in the session before leveling out. Losses for the quarter were $1.52 per share, larger than the $1.36 per share loss projected by the Street. The company blames the miss on substantial idle time for one of its crude oil vessels, as well as a write down and higher operational expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications (FTR +11.7%) is staging a post-earnings rally, as investors focus on...

    Frontier Communications (FTR +11.7%) is staging a post-earnings rally, as investors focus on healthy free cash flow and broadband/TV net adds rather than expected wireline sub losses. Nomura (Buy) is hiking its 2012 revenue forecast. Jefferies (Buy) notes Frontier's adjusted EBITDA margin hit a near-term high of 49.3%, and argues its dividend payout ratio will likely stay above 50% for several years (Frontier's current yield is 9.1%). Also up: CTL +2.2%. WIN +1.4%. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -2.8%) mentions in its Q2 10-Q that 103M of its 543M mobile monthly users only...

    Facebook (FB -2.8%) mentions in its Q2 10-Q that 103M of its 543M mobile monthly users only accessed its services via mobile devices; that helps explain Facebook's U.S. ad impression drop, and drives home the company's need to improve mobile monetization ASAP. Also mentioned: Zynga (ZNGA -4.1%) made up 14% of revenue, down from Q1's 19%; $633M was spent in 1H on patent acquisitions; and duplicate accounts could make up 4.8% of users (46M).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • PXD

    Shares of Pioneer Resources (PXD +6.5%) shrug off a Q2 bottom line miss due to writedowns and...

    Shares of Pioneer Resources (PXD +6.5%) shrug off a Q2 bottom line miss due to writedowns and power higher on the back of strong top line results. Revenue was solid, +15% Y/Y despite slack commodity prices. The company also raised its 2012 production growth target to a range of 25% to 29%, and increased its net resource potential from 5 billion BOE to more than 7 billion BOE.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • BVN

    Peruvian miner Buenaventura (BVN -5.2%) posts Q2 EPS of $0.60 vs. analyst consensus of $0.81, on revenue of $350M, down 23% Y/Y and missing estimates by $42M.     InterDigital (IDCC +14.6%) takes off after a U.S. federal appeals court rules (.pdf) in the...

    InterDigital (IDCC +14.6%) takes off after a U.S. federal appeals court rules (.pdf) in the company's favor in a long-running suit against Nokia (NOK +4.2%) related to InterDigital's 3G patents. By doing so, the court is reversing an ITC decision in Nokia's favor, and remanding the case for further review. Update: InterDigital has issued a PR praising the ruling, and stating it will again ask the ITC to ban Nokia products using the W-CDMA 3G interface (used by AT&T and T-Mobile).
